Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location, Great Price”
Reviews.Author: lotegil
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in the most upscale Madrid neighborhood, fine shopping, good restaurants are located right around the corner. The staff is friendly and willing to help out, the A/C unit works perfectly, and the rooms have good size considering the average size of other European hotels. The Serrano and Velazquez Metro stations are 2 block walk away, about 200 meters to each one. There are starbucks and other fine coffee shops less than 3 blocks away, and a market is located right inf front if you need it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Sabrina M
Reviews.Content: Perfect location! Very clean. A good value. In one of the nicest barrios in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “True to pictures”
Reviews.Author: Ana Catalina I
Reviews.Content: Is very well located in "El barrio Salamanca". The decor is right like the pictures they show. Its a good hotel. My husband visited it for business and we went back as a family this June 2012. The breakfast is good and the hotel mendaciously clean. The staff is friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Not my 1st choice in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: John J
Reviews.Content: NH Lagasca was my 2nd choice for a 3 day business trip. Perfect location, beautiful exteriors, but the room was a great disappointment. Only upside was the comfortable furnishing, but soured by small & awkward room, plus poor maintenance (dirty towels on day 2). Still not my 1st choice.

Reviews.Title: “location good but disappointing by comparison with other NH hotels”
Reviews.Author: gaffelaar
Reviews.Content: You pay a high price for the swanky location, but in fact the hotel is in a so so street 5 mins walk from where you want to be. Service also so so and a large dark room spoiled by poor maintenance and a down at heel feel (footstool with leg missing for instance). Breakfast also so so. I thought the price was way to high for the offer and would not go back to this one.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: MarkC82
Reviews.Content: A very tidy and comfortable hotel located in a quiet area, but the centre of Madrid is still within easy reach

Reviews.Title: “Very Small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Eleni_gak
Reviews.Content: The location is fantastic!! You are in the middle of everything: shops, restaurants, metro station etc. The hotel is clean and the breakfast very good and with a lot of options. But the room was very small and dark, maybe because it was not facing the street.

Reviews.Title: “Nice tapas bars nearb”
Reviews.Author: seven89
Reviews.Content: Clean room, clean bathroom, good NH standard, close to nice restaurants and tapas bars. I was on a business trip and just one night in this hotel. No big traffic at night, taxi to the airport is about 22 Euro. Great breakfast with fine jamon iberico and a choice of everything. Would go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Functional and quiet”
Reviews.Author: Pi31415
Reviews.Content: My favourite hotel in Madrid was sold out and I opted for one near the meeting I was to attend. I booked a superior room which was spacious, clean and functional. The a/c is loud and I ended up opening the windows to cool down. The bed was very comfortable, if a bit creaky when I turned over! The breakfast buffet was a work of art - a lovely spread with a fine choice of fruits, cereals, yoghurts, nuts, bread and juices. Scrambled egg and chorizo were also available. The reception/lobby area is small. Having stayed in many hotels in Madrid, this hotel is above the average and a good 'reserve' should my preference be booked again!

Reviews.Title: “Affordable, clean and quiet”
Reviews.Author: minilie
Reviews.Content: We had book a room well in advance in the dead season so we had a very good price. (60 euros/night). Very clean bedroom, Quiet at night. Make sure you book a room facing the street as the first room we were given was facing the courtyard was very dark and small. The man at reception didnt mind changing the room. The location is perfect. The breakfast was very expensive (18 euros) so I cannot comment on that. But overall, very satisfied. I have been to many hotels in the Salamanca district and it was by far, the best one.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: rratier
Reviews.Content: Because of the earlier reviwes, we were kind of skeptical about this hotel. But there waqs nothing to fear, we found. My and my wife stayed at NH Lagasca for 4 nights in May. There is not one thing bad to say about this hotel. Well, maybe one: there is no free wifi in the rooms, only at the lobby. With that exception, all the rest was just fine. Complete rooms, new and clean, very comfortable bed, good AC system (even though being centrally controlled), atentious staff, complimentary newspaper at the lobby and an excellent location at the heart of barrio Salamanca, full of stores and fine restaurants. Hotel hotel rests in a quiet and leavy street, no more that 5 min on foot to the nearest subway and 10-15 min to Retiro Park.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: DulcedelecheParis
Reviews.Content: Friendly and helpful staff. Small and dark rooms if you are not facing the street. Calm, no noise or slamming doors. Good and clean bathrooms with bath and shower and nice fresh shower gel, soap and other useful toiletries (complimentary toothbrush & toothpaste, razor, sponge...). Good spacious closet with plenty of hangers, safe and extra pillow & blanket. Hard to carry suitcase up three steep steps to reach the elevator from the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Bomp29
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, clean and confortabile. A great ratio between quality and price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: StevenInLBC
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in an upscale are in Madrid and is still very central. The room was modern, stylish, comfortable. In general, an excellent value for the price paid. I've stayed in a few other NH hotels and this is definitely the nicest so far.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible service, arrogant staff”
Reviews.Author: TravelerMarkH
Reviews.Content: We are frequent international travelers and this is the rudest most arrogant staff I have ever encountered. We ended up in Madrid to avoid the volcanic ash cloud for the return trip home from Europe. We booked this hotel based on recommendation from a friend. When we arrived from our flight in the evening and asked to borrow an iron and an ironing board to go out to dinner with ironed clothes, they refused, saying that they do not lend irons for "security" reasons. They offered to have our clothes ironed for 7.50 Euros per item, but it would take a few hours. Rather than being apologetic about this ridiculous policy, they acted as though this was the only reasonable policy to have! Their "free" wi-fi in the lobby is actually for 30 minutes a day, you have to get a new code from them daily. The internet is incredibly slow. There is no pool in the hotel as advertised on their website. I would characterize the buffet breakfast as average. The last morning we were there, there was no eggs until we were ready to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Rudest Staff in Spain”
Reviews.Author: tnaworld
Reviews.Content: While the hotel itself is nice enough and certainly well located, we felt it necessary to share our miserable experience with the night staff at the front desk to warn off travellers looking for a stress-free stay in Madrid. My husband and I arrived at the hotel separately, him having come earlier in the day to attend a business meeting and evening reception. I flew in on a later flight into Spain and arrived at the hotel later in the evening. Knowing my husband would still be out, he had earlier in the day arranged with the front desk staff for me to pick up a key when I arrived. However, when I arrived, there was no record of this and I ended up in a situation where I was receiving abuse from the front desk clerk calling me a liar. The point was not so much that there was no record and so they could not give me the key, but rather that he immediately resorted to brushing me off and refusing to look further into it (despite my being on crutches at the time and also holding the confirmation numbers for the reservation). It was only when I parked myself in the lobby, clearly refusing to leave, that he finally did as I had originally asked and called the desk clerk who had been working earlier in the day at the time my husband had arranged the key to be given to me. When the day clerk confirmed my/our story, the night clerk did eventually give me the key but did it in such a disgruntled way and when I asked for an apology, he outright refused. This is unacceptable for a hotel of this class and so I would recommend other travellers to take their business to any one of the other comparable hotels nearby - there are plenty to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel in the most exclusive part of town”
Reviews.Author: Colinko
Reviews.Content: Functional, clean, excellent breakfast, great location and a free mini bar. What more could you want on NYE?! We cant recommend this hotel (and the chain) highly enough. We stayed in another NH property in Amsterdam that was equaly as impressive. And to note were sophisticated 30 somethings not rampaging teenagers.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable”
Reviews.Author: IdRatherBeAtHome
Reviews.Content: Room was small, had to get a change, which was acomodated. No iron facility was the biggest frustration and then being charged for my business shirts to be ironed. I had no idea there was a breakfast area, which I found out when I checked out, but that was minor. The staff could be more accomodating, but as a whole a reasonable location and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “just perfect”
Reviews.Author: bl0ndie29
Reviews.Content: everythin was gr8 about the hotel. price was so reasonable (euro 92 per room per nite) the staff really were very helpful and went out of their way to help with any requests we had. the breakfast was included in price, served til 12 on wkends and was delish. location was fab, quite upmarket area but with brill selection of shops & restaurants for all price ranges on the door step. if i ever return to madrid there will be no other place to stay

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Yiannis_9
Reviews.Content: Dr Yiannis, UK Excellent, Excellent, Excellent. Nothing more to say. Stuff, location, hotel services, hospitality, cleaniness, friendliness to children were all well above expectation. I never stay in less than 4 star hotel, and NH lagasca was probably one of the best hotel ever stayed

Reviews.Title: “Loved the NH”
Reviews.Author: PCorneliaBH
Reviews.Content: Great hotel and service, excelent breakfast. The room we stayed at was lovely, clean, spacious and newly refurbushed.. We just felt so pampered and it made the whole visit to Madrid a great experience. The only thing I could say is that it does not have a nice view of the city, but it is so conveniently located that you can walk everywhere, and the staff is just great. Hope you enjoy it as much

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: katje
Reviews.Content: We spent our Easter Holiday in Spain, and we spent 2 nights in this hotel. The location is excellent, especially if somebody would like to shopping or window shopping. In the neighborhood lots of small nice cafes and you can find the nicest designer shops, but also you can find 2 or 3 El Corte Ingles department stores. The underground is about 5 minutes from the hotel, but you can reach easily the marvellous city center by walk as well. The walk takes approx. 20 minutes. The hotel staff is kind and helpful, the breakfast is really great, but the rooms are very very small and dark. Our window gave to a 'lichthof', so it was definitely dark and without fresh air. The bathroom was okay and clean.
